cluster_relations.rel_desc: The oral traditions are a component of German culture.
cluster_relations.subject_class_label: German Cultural Heritage and Oral Traditions
cluster_relations.object_class_label: German Cultural Heritage and Oral Traditions

qualifiers.TemporalQualifier: existing for generations before being recorded

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that instances of the subject concept characteristically or commonly include the object as a recurring element or motif.
args.justification: The relation describes that fairytales commonly include magical elements as characteristic motifs, which is best modeled as a habitual/typical feature rather than a strict part-whole or one-off occurrence.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is a constituent or component of the broader whole represented by the object.
args.justification: The description explicitly states that oral traditions are a component of German culture, which is a standard part-whole relation between a cultural practice and a larger cultural system.
This relation connects a narrative genre (fairytales) to a recurring motif (magical elements), fitting a class for how narrative motifs typically feature within narrative types.
The relation links a specific practice/form (oral traditions) to a larger cultural entity (German culture), which is best grouped as a component-to-culture relation class.

Both relations describe how something forms part of or is characteristically included within a larger whole: magical elements as constituent motifs of fairytales, and oral traditions as a component of German culture.
